Line 157: Line 157:
===Mobile phones===
===Mobile phones===
  +
[[File:Galaxy Nexus smartphone.jpg|thumb|150px|The [[Galaxy Nexus]], developed in partnership with [[Google]]]]
Samsung Electronics sold 235 million mobile handsets in the year 2009.<ref>{{cite news|url= http://www.livbit.com/article/2010/02/23/2009-mobile-phone-sales-report-released-nokia-still-rules-trailed-by-samsung/|title=2009 mobile phone sales report released, Nokia still rules trailed by Samsung |date= February 23, 2010 |publisher= Livbit}}</ref> At the end of Q3 2010 Samsung had surpassed the 70 million unit mark in shipped phones, giving it a global marketshare of 22% trailing [[Nokia]] by 12%.<ref>http://www.applelinks.com/index.php/more/applelinks_ios_news_reader_monday_november_1_2010/</ref>
Samsung Electronics sold 235 million mobile handsets in the year 2009.<ref>{{cite news|url= http://www.livbit.com/article/2010/02/23/2009-mobile-phone-sales-report-released-nokia-still-rules-trailed-by-samsung/|title=2009 mobile phone sales report released, Nokia still rules trailed by Samsung |date= February 23, 2010 |publisher= Livbit}}</ref> At the end of Q3 2010 Samsung had surpassed the 70 million unit mark in shipped phones, giving it a global marketshare of 22% trailing [[Nokia]] by 12%.<ref>http://www.applelinks.com/index.php/more/applelinks_ios_news_reader_monday_november_1_2010/</ref>
Overall, Samsung sold 280 million mobile phones in 2010, corresponding to a market share of 20.2%.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mobileburn.com/news.jsp?Id=12703|title=Nokia, LG lose while ZTE, Apple gain Q4 2010 market share|publisher=mobileburn.com|date=2011-01-28}}</ref>
Overall, Samsung sold 280 million mobile phones in 2010, corresponding to a market share of 20.2%.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mobileburn.com/news.jsp?Id=12703|title=Nokia, LG lose while ZTE, Apple gain Q4 2010 market share|publisher=mobileburn.com|date=2011-01-28}}</ref>
